revised_title: Description and Classification of the Coot-footed Tringa
tldr: In a letter to the Royal Society, George Edwards describes a new species of snipe or tringa, which he names the "coot-footed tringa." This bird has webbed feet similar to the fulica or bald-coot and is distinguished by its unique scalloped and pectinated toes. Edwards provides a detailed description of the bird's physical characteristics, including its size, coloration, bill shape, and eye placement. He also discusses the bird's habitat and behavior, as well as its probable origins and potential for further discovery.
